translated: Question about whether the Buddha exists in the past

analyzed: bhante nāgasena buddhaḥ tayā diṭṭhaḥ ti
translated: “Did you see the Buddha, revered Nāgasena?”

analyzed: atha te ācariyehi buddhaḥ diṭṭhaḥ ti
translated: “Well then, did your teachers see the Buddha?”

analyzed: tena hi bhante nāgasena na atthi buddhaḥ ti
translated: “Well then, revered Nāgasena, there is no Buddha.”

original: “Kiṁ pana, mahārāja, himavati ūhā nadī tayā diṭṭhā”ti?
analyzed: kim pana mahā rāja himavati ūhā nadī tayā diṭṭhā ati
translated: “But, your majesty, did you see the river Uhā in the Himalayas?”

analyzed: atha te pitaraḥ ūhā nadī diṭṭhā ati
translated: “Well then, did your father see the river Uhā?”

analyzed: tena hi mahā rāja natthi ūhā nadī iti
translated: “Well then, your majesty, there is no river Uhā.”

original: “Atthi, bhante, kiñcāpi mayā ūhā nadī na diṭṭhā, pitarāpi me ūhā nadī na diṭṭhā, api ca atthi ūhā nadī”ti.
analyzed: atthi bhante kiñca api mayā ūhā nadī na diṭṭhā pitarā api me ūhā nadī na diṭṭhā api ca atthi ūhā nadī iti
translated: “There is, revered sir, though I have not seen the river Uhā nor has my father.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, kiñcāpi mayā bhagavā na diṭṭho, ācariyehipi me bhagavā na diṭṭho, api ca atthi bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja kiñca api mayā bhagavā na diṭṭhaḥ me bhagavā na diṭṭhaḥ api ca atthi bhagavā ati
translated: “Even so, your majesty, though I have not seen the Blessed One nor have my teachers, still there is a Blessed One.”
“You are a wise man, revered Nāgasena.”

analyzed: buddhassa atthi natthi bhāva pañhaḥ paṭhamaḥ
translated: The first question of King Milinda
